library.description: Chaplin is an architecture for JavaScript applications using the Backbone.js library. The code is derived from moviepilot.com, a large single-page application.
library.name: Chaplin

library.description:
Graphene is a realtime dashboard & graphing toolkit based on D3 and Backbone.

It was made to offer a very aesthetic realtime dashboard that lives on top of Graphite (but could be tailored to any back end, eventually).

Combining D3's immense capabilities of managing live data, and Backbone's ease of development, Graphene provides a solution capable of displaying thousands upon thousands of datapoints in your dashboard, as well as presenting a very hackable project to build on and customize.
library.name: Graphene

library.description: Gem.js is a view library - a system for building modular and composable web components and styles, as well as a set of extensible web components for building visual user interfaces and styling web applications in pure-javascript.
library.name: Gem.js

library.description: Bind models to views in Backbone style. Stickit offers a simple javascript configuration approach to model binding and seamlessly integrates into a Backbone project.
library.name: Stickit

library.description: Backbone.js gives structure to web applications by providing models with key-value binding and custom events, collections with a rich API of enumerable functions, views with declarative event handling, and connects it all to your existing API over a RESTful JSON interface.
library.name: Backbone.js

library.description: A composite application framework and infrastructure for Backbone. Make your Backbone applications dance!
library.name: MarionetteJS

library.description: A browser extension that takes JavaScript frameworks and makes their internals visible, including views, models, class names, and more.
library.name: Illuminations for Developers

library.description: Backbone.Rebar extends the Backbone.js library with view transitions, subviews, view mediators, local storage for sync, dynamic route definitions, controllers, and a simple log wrapper. Backbone.Rebar is only 3.13kB minified and gzipped with no other dependencies being added to Backbone.
library.name: Backbone.Rebar

library.description: Few tested opinions on how to handle deeply nested views in Backbone.js focusing on encapsulation and reusability.
library.name: Backbone.ViewMaster

library.description: Rivets.js is a declarative data binding facility that plays well with existing frameworks such as Backbone.js, Spine.js and Stapes.js. It aims to be lightweight (2.3KB minified and gzipped), extensible, and configurable to work with any event-driven model.
library.name: Rivets

library.description: Epoxy is an elegant and extensible data binding library for Backbone.js; it provides feature-rich extensions of Backbone's Model and View components designed to hook view elements directly to data models. Epoxy captures some great aspects of Knockout.js and Ember.js in a familiar API that feels tastefully like Backbone, with minimal additional file size (8k min, 3k gzip). Some key features in Epoxy include:
library.name: Epoxy.js

library.description: Btapp.js provides a Backbone based library that interfaces with underlying BitTorrent products, such as BitTorrent, uTorrent, or the gui-less Torque product. Allows for easy torrent downloading via your web app.
library.name: Btapp.js
